column1: We still do not understand or even know about many of the long term effects of COVID-19.   Wear your mask social distance & stay home.  https://t.co/bo8WQkSWV7

As we venture further into this pandemic we are starting to learn more about the long term effects of COVID-19. It is promising to see programs such as this one at @UABnews help those on the long road to recovery.  https://t.co/KwugQvvc2S

It's an honor to receive the Legislative Champion Award from @COAUSPHS for my bipartisan work passing a new law to strengthen our Reserve Ready Corps. Especially as we battle COVID-19 this is critical to backfilling our frontline health workers as many deploy to hard-hit areas. https://t.co/wZXkmebg5D

While this is exciting news we cannot ease up on our efforts to stop the spread of this virus just yet. I know I sound like a broken record but we must continue to wear our masks social distance & stay home as much as possible. #MaskUpAL  https://t.co/tWyans67sm

On Wednesday November 18 join @DrJeanneM from @UABNews and me for a FB livestream at 9:30 a.m. ET where we will discuss Alabama COVID-19 updates and other news of the day.   Join us live here: https://t.co/olFgVVmTRe… https://t.co/hXptdbg4Pn

Our children are the future but the #COVID19 pandemic is putting their health at risk here at home & around the world—setting back years of progress & investment from the U.S. As we kick off #ChildHealthWeek let’s recommit to working hard on behalf of children around the world.

Even before COVID-19 the U.S. had one of the highest rates of maternal deaths in the world. My bipartisan Maternal Outcomes Matter Act will work to address this & give all women access to quality care. https://t.co/2sruGN5Fwj
We cannot let up now. The message hasn’t changed: wear your mask social distance & stay home. https://t.co/Eh3vqySQih

During the COVID-19 pandemic our teachers are frontline workers — and that's not up for debate. My Reopen Schools Safely Act would ensure Alabama schools have the funding they need to meet CDC guidelines & ensure the safety of both students & staff.  https://t.co/FknTOgOI7M
I’m proud to stand with small business owners. That's why I introduced bipartisan legislation to help businesses hit hard by COVID-19 & recent natural disasters in Alabama.

In May I introduced a bill that was signed in to law to require private health insurance companies to cover any COVID vaccines or treatments that are developed. This is another great step forward. https://t.co/GPytloWyKT

I also believe his decision to force through this confirmation instead of negotiating a bipartisan COVID relief package is an insult to the millions of Americans who are suffering as a result of this pandemic.
COVID cases are spiking across the country. We ALL need to work together and wear our masks. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/oMTXjOFrXx

I know many families across Alabama love to celebrate Halloween with trick-or-treating. But this year in light of the COVID-19 pandemic I want to encourage you to look toward safe and fun alternatives. 👻🎃 https://t.co/t0lbm4df7s

Hey y’all it’s not too late to get your flu shot! Getting your flu shot is going to be critical in helping us fight COVID-19 this winter & keep our health care systems from being overwhelmed. https://t.co/Ho3Po5Wooh

Let's continue to listen to our public health experts like Dr. Fauci and wear our masks stay home and social distance as much as possible. We can beat this virus but it’s going to take all of us. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/Gxt3cFYedg

Throughout this pandemic I have been so proud of all the ingenuity coming from Alabama. This new test is just another development that can greatly benefit Americans as we continue to battle COVID-19.https://t.co/eVtYLqo4nf

Every week that Congress fails to pass more COVID relief millions more Americans struggle to pay their bills and put food on the table. We have to stand up for working families and pass a comprehensive bill ASAP to help the folks who are struggling. https://t.co/XUmAYN5zjf

Everyone 6 months or older should get the flu shot—especially this year as we continue to fight COVID-19.    The vaccine is: ✅ Safe  ✅ Does not cause the flu  ✅ Helps to prevent the flu which shares many of the same symptoms as COVID-19  https://t.co/nwqNIwt2n8

This is great news for Bibb & Tuscaloosa counties! This expansion & the 373 added jobs are crucial as we continue to still see high unemployment rates due to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/UNMUasCK4I

I got my flu shot have you gotten yours yet? Getting your flu shot is an easy effective way to help prevent the flu and to prevent additional strain on our health care systems during the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/W2PSD7vslI

This serves as a reminder of just how tricky this virus can be to detect & how quickly it can spread. Please continue to wear your mask social distance & stay home as much as possible. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/lYK14DqtIo

What do asthma diabetes & cancer have in common with COVID-19?   All are considered pre-existing conditions.    If the #ACA is struck down in the Supreme Court millions of Americans with pre-existing conditions will be at risk of losing coverage and care. #ProtectOurCare

Stories of folks struggling due to lack of rural health care are all too familiar here in Alabama. Protecting the ACA is critical to ensuring all Alabamians have accessible & affordable health care—especially as we continue to fight against COVID-19.  https://t.co/Vrq4Zfq4O0

Folks we’re still in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic & we're also headed into flu season. Please continue wearing a mask & social distancing. If you test positive for COVID-19 you need to quarantine to ensure you don’t further spread this dangerous virus. #MaskUpAL

It's more important than ever to make sure you get your flu shot this year. Please make a plan to get it now. While it won't prevent COVID it can help prevent you from getting the flu and COVID at the same time. For more information please visit: https://t.co/nwqNIwKDeG

The numbers don’t lie—since the first mask order we have seen COVID cases decline in Alabama. Yesterday the mask order was extended until NOVEMBER 8 & I’m hoping we will continue to see cases decrease. We're in this together. #MaskUpAL  https://t.co/vEDUgYZWkq

Yesterday marked a somber milestone for our world as we surpassed 1 million deaths globally from coronavirus. Folks let’s continue to wear our masks & socially distance ourselves in an effort to protect our neighbors & help stop the spread. https://t.co/4Lj3q5opgg

When we wear a mask we send a message to our community that we care about them too. It’s going to take all of us but let’s come together to mask up social distance & stay home. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/Bgk5NhyLIW

After enduring COVID & #HurricaneSally many of Alabama's Main Street businesses need more help to recover and rebuild. My new bill with @SenJohnKennedy will allow disaster-hit businesses to receive CARES Act loan forgiveness. Read more: https://t.co/yUZumG6WYS

Folks we can—and must—do better. Let’s work together to beat COVID-19 by wearing our masks social distancing & staying home as much as possible. Doing the work now will ensure a quicker return to a sense of normalcy. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/9gqMtrNQya

Thank you @GovernorKayIvey for your leadership during this difficult time. I know no one wants to wear the masks & stay home but we can’t deny it is helping to slow COVID here in Alabama. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/f4Q0EbCPpg

This is great news out of UAB! I’m proud to see Alabama on the frontlines in the fight against COVID-19. Congrats to @UABnews for leading cutting-edge research to help folks all across our nation and world combat this virus. https://t.co/mLB3L2T3BY

Tomorrow August 27 at 1:00 p.m. CT join Tuscaloosa Mayor @WaltMaddox & me for a live press conference where we will discuss the latest on the COVID-19 pandemic & other news of the day.   Tune in here: https://t.co/2z1C35hOHK https://t.co/mp53ZookHp

In less than a week UA has already seen *over 500 cases* on campus.    Y’all I know we want to get back to normal but that means we each have to take personal responsibility to wear masks social distance & stay home. It’s that simple. #MaskUpAL  https://t.co/KlOhavbdoK

During the COVID-19 pandemic we rely on our postal service more than ever. We must protect the USPS its workers & the vital services they provide to every zip code across the country. This isn’t just about the mail—it’s about lives & livelihoods. #DontMessWithUSPS
Folks we can’t let up now. The mask mandate is working but we each have to do our part. Remember to social distance stay home as much as possible and to #MaskUpAL! https://t.co/VzxOiB4tRf

I want to see college football return just as much as the next fan—but it is problematic if folks continue to ignore the healthcare professionals. Please wear a mask social distance & stay home. https://t.co/CjTywdyRN6

This story is a great example of what we can do when we work together toward a common goal. Thanks to all the folks at Ft. Rucker who are working around the clock—even with the new challenges presented by COVID—to ensure their mission gets carried out. https://t.co/V46ZG7UXXq

McConnell’s decision to send the Senate home for a month without a COVID relief deal is an unconscionable failure of leadership and an insult to the sacrifices that so many Americans have made to get this virus under control.   My full statement here:  https://t.co/qatH5YTpxf

Minority-owned businesses have been disproportionately hard hit by the COVID-19 pandemic. Yesterday I hosted a roundtable to discuss how to ensure our small businesses have the resources needed to not only survive this crisis but also to grow and stay in Alabama. https://t.co/nLOCKZrryG

We now have had over 100K reported COVID cases in Alabama. Folks we can beat this virus but it’s going to take all of us doing our part. Wear your mask social distance and stay home as much as you can. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/NjPGh8Ot4z

Misinformation about COVID-19 is spreading almost as quickly as this virus—which is too fast. Please ensure you are getting your information from verified sources and listen to public health experts. https://t.co/DjrLiIICSs

Seniors & folks with disabilities are at higher risk of complications from COVID-19. The next relief bill needs to include funding to support nursing homes long-term care facilities & home & community-based services. No one should be left behind during a public health crisis.

More than 1700 Alabamians have now died from COVID-19. These aren’t just numbers—they’re our neighbors family and friends. Folks please wear your mask and stay home as much as possible so we can prevent further suffering. https://t.co/BgrSTxpKcH

In Alabama 22% of COVID cases are from people under the age of 25. Y'all this isn’t just the “sniffles"—the after effects of COVID can be devastating & disruptive to young people as well. Let's each do our part by wearing a mask & social distancing. https://t.co/p7ixYRcgj8

Over the past 14 days Alabama has reported over 18000 new coronavirus cases—accounting for 32% of the state’s total cases since the pandemic started.    I can’t say it enough: we have to do better.    Wear your mask social distance & stay home.

We need to do everything we can to make sure folks can get the help they need during these hard times. The next COVID relief package must include the resources states need to process the surge of unemployment claims they're seeing. https://t.co/IKPJIB7nr7

I can't believe I have to say this but: more COVID-19 cases means more death more strain on struggling hospitals more isolation. We get further from fully reopening our economy.  It's not only irresponsible to welcome the spread of COVID-19 it's dangerous and deadly.

Less than two hours after opening a Huntsville COVID-19 testing site reached capacity. *Less than two hours.*   This is unacceptable—we are now months into this pandemic & we still don’t have the adequate tools necessary to fight this & stay safe. https://t.co/TWf0DdV8hj

I know we're all eager to do our part to further prevent the spread of COVID-19—but one thing that won’t help is misinformation. I know it’s easy to share a post you think is helpful but please make sure it's accurate.   Wearing a mask is safe & effective.https://t.co/EZfyAB5Z7F

Wearing a mask should *NOT* be a political issue—this isn’t red versus blue.   It’s about all Americans coming together to protect one another. We can and we will beat COVID-19—but we simply cannot continue to politicize this pandemic.

Folks currently there is no clear treatment for COVID-19. I want to remind everyone that the best way to keep safe is by staying home social distancing & washing your hands. If you are showing symptoms or think you might be sick immediately contact your health care provider.

I know for many folks celebrating Easter tomorrow will be different. But let’s remember that faith isn’t kept inside the walls of a building but instead is carried with us everywhere we go. Let’s all come together to stay apart and prevent COVID-19 from spreading further.

Folks we are expecting some severe weather this weekend in Alabama.
